title: Feature Request: search by keywords in items description

labels.name: T-rustdoc
labels.description: Relevant to the rustdoc team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: C-feature-request
labels.description: Category: A feature request, i.e: not implemented / a PR.

body:
# Proposal

## Problem
I find it incredibly difficult to search through an API by just items names, descriptions are more clearer and meaningful than items names.

Most developers are used to using `Algolia` for example for searching in documentation which is very elastic/flexible/fast.

### Scenario
Imagine you're writing a GUI app using one of the popular libraries available like [`Egui`] for example and you want to know how to set the transparency of a window during runtime in one of the lifecycle methods.

How can you search for such functionality without a description like this?
```
Ex: "window desc: set transparency during runtime"
```

## Terminology
#### The term `description` in this context
Anything written in the documentation comments above items excluding code blocks is considered an item description.

## Solution
Searching for keywords in items descriptions will be easier/faster than guessing the name for the functionality someone needs

## Implementation
- Text for filtering/searching items names.
```
Ex: "window"
```
- Prefixing with `desc:` for searching with description.
```
Ex: "desc: set window size during runtime"
```
- Compining search with item's name and description.
```
Ex: "window desc: set window size during runtime"
```
